items.title: Series SEA: Who’s investing in the region’s health startups?
items.summary:
- This article discusses active investors in Southeast Asia’s health startup scene.
- It features a constantly updated list of investors who have backed health startups in the region over the past two years, arranged by the number of deals.
- The focus is on firms that have invested in three or more companies within the specified timeframe.

items.title: Blockchain startup raises $2.5m pre-seed
items.summary:
- Blockchain startup Printr raised US$2.5 million in a pre-seed funding round.
- Investors include Sfermion, Draper Dragon, Bitscale, Hermeneutic, Sui Foundation, Axelar Foundation, and Flow Foundation.
- Funds will be used for team expansion, platform development, and operational needs.
- The platform allows users to launch memecoins across networks such as Ethereum, Solana, Sui, BNB, and Base.
- Printr’s launch coincides with a 600% increase in the total value locked in the Solana network over the past 12 months.

items.title: LG acquires US-based AI startup to expand robotic portfolio
items.summary:
- LG Electronics acquired a 51% stake in Bear Robotics, a California-based AI robotics startup, for approximately $180 million on January 24.
- The acquisition values Bear Robotics at around $600 million and makes it a subsidiary of LG Electronics.
- This follows LG's previous $60 million investment in Bear Robotics in March 2024, which made it the largest shareholder at that time.
- The deal aims to integrate Bear Robotics’ technology into LG's CLOi Robots portfolio to enhance its robotics presence.
- Financial details will be disclosed once the deal is finalized, amid increasing competition in the robotics industry, particularly from rival Samsung.

items.title: AppsFlyer appoints new chief business officer ahead of IPO
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- AppsFlyer appoints Gal Ekstein as chief business officer (CBO) as it prepares for a potential IPO.
- Ekstein, with the company for five years, will oversee global go-to-market strategies for expansion.
- He achieved a revenue increase of 3.3 times in EMEA and Latin America.
- Other leadership updates include Hadas Almog as chief people officer and Lisa Zaythik as chief culture officer.
- AppsFlyer reported US$400 million in annual recurring revenue and is working with Goldman Sachs, JP Morgan, and Bank of America on the IPO, aiming to raise US$300 million.

items.title: Blackstone to invest $6b data centers in India
items.summary:
- Blackstone is set to invest $6 billion in data centers across India.
- This investment aims to enhance India's digital infrastructure and cater to the growing demand for data management services.
- The move is part of Blackstone's broader strategy to expand its presence in the Indian market.

items.title: Indian edtech upGrad commits $248m to build AI centers
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- upGrad commits 2,150 crore rupees (US$248.82 million) to establish AI excellence centers in Maharashtra.
- Initiative aims to train over 1 million students in AI and emerging technologies, targeting urban and rural areas.
- Plans include hybrid programs in AI, digital transformation, and gaming, formalized through a MoU signed by Maharashtra CM and upGrad co-founder.
- Second phase focuses on training 250,000 rural youth and promoting entrepreneurship.
- upGrad valued at US$2.25 billion after raising US$60 million from Temasek, preparing for potential IPO by mid-2026.

items.title: Taiwan’s industrial growth fueled by tech, AI in 2024
items.summary:
- Taiwan's industrial growth is being significantly influenced by advancements in technology and artificial intelligence in 2024.
- The focus on tech is expected to enhance productivity and innovation across various sectors.
- AI integration is particularly pivotal for Taiwan's manufacturing and service industries, leading to more competitive market positioning.
- Forecasts suggest continued expansion and adoption of tech solutions throughout the year.

items.title: Swedish AI firm Sana Labs plans US IPO in coming years
items.author: Joel Hellermark
items.summary:
- Sana Labs AB plans to execute a US IPO within the next few years.
- The move is part of a trend among Swedish companies seeking larger US capital markets, following in the footsteps of Spotify and Klarna Bank.
- Founded in 2016, Sana Labs creates AI agents for enterprise tasks and counts Novartis AG and Merck & Co. among its clients.
- Competes with tech giants like Microsoft and OpenAI, focusing on solving enterprise queries with multi-step AI actions.
- Raised US$55 million last year in a funding round, valuing the company at US$500 million.
- Plans to expand the workforce to 320 employees this year and increase operations in New York and London while boosting research in Stockholm.

items.title: ByteDance joins artificial general intelligence race
items.summary:
- ByteDance introduces new AI research initiative called Seed Edge focused on artificial general intelligence (AGI).
- Initiative aims to enhance reasoning abilities, machine perceptual capabilities, and explore advanced machine-learning paradigms.
- ByteDance plans to invest 4.5 billion yuan (US$615 million) in a new computing center in Shanxi province.
- By launching Seed Edge, ByteDance enters the competitive AGI field alongside tech giants like OpenAI.

items.title: Wall Street execs eye crypto as Trump pushes digital assets
items.summary:
- Wall Street executives are increasingly interested in cryptocurrency, depending on favorable US regulations.
- Morgan Stanley CEO Ted Pick calls for regulatory clarity for the bank's operations.
- Bank of America CEO Brian Moynihan suggests clear guidelines could enhance cryptocurrency as a payment option.
- US President Donald Trump has adopted a pro-cryptocurrency position, promoting digital assets through an executive order.
- Bitcoin reached an all-time high of US$110,000 and remains at US$106,000.
- Analysts anticipate heightened institutional interest in the crypto market with eased regulations.

items.title: Dutch chipmaker ASML faces challenges, sees long-term growth
items.summary:
- ASML Holding NV will release its quarterly results next week amid scrutiny over client spending and market challenges.
- The company has seen a nearly 30% stock decline since July due to a reduced 2025 revenue outlook.
- Analysts forecast ASML’s 2025 sales to be €32.2 billion, slightly below its guidance, due to spending fluctuations from major clients.
- TSMC may provide relief with its US$40 billion capital expenditure plans for 2025.
- ASML remains optimistic about long-term growth, reiterating its 2030 growth targets with an expected 16% annual earnings growth rate.

items.title: European Central Bank pitches digital euro amid Trump order
items.summary:
- The European Central Bank (ECB) is advocating for a digital euro.
- This initiative comes in the context of recent financial regulations influenced by a Trump order.
- The digital euro aims to enhance the efficiency of payments and support financial stability.
- The ECB considers public consultations and stakeholder engagements essential for the process.
- Concerns regarding privacy and cybersecurity related to digital currencies are being addressed.

items.title: Indian publishers sue OpenAI over copyright issues
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Indian book publishers and international counterparts have filed a copyright lawsuit against OpenAI at the Delhi High Court.
- The lawsuit, led by the Federation of Indian Publishers, claims that OpenAI’s ChatGPT generates summaries from proprietary content.
- Publishers include Bloomsbury, Penguin Random House, Cambridge University Press, and Pan Macmillan, seeking removal of datasets and compensation for losses.
- OpenAI has not commented on the case but cites fair-use principles for its data usage.
- This lawsuit is part of a global increase in legal challenges against AI-related copyright infringement.

items.title: Hong Kong’s crypto hub ambitions challenged by US policies
items.summary:
- Hong Kong aims to be a global virtual-asset hub but faces challenges from new US policies.
- President Trump signed an executive order to enhance the US digital asset sector, forming a cryptocurrency regulation working group.
- This change might diminish Hong Kong's attractiveness for international crypto businesses.
- BitMEX CEO Stephan Lutz indicated potential talent and firm migration away from Hong Kong.
- US regulations may complicate Hong Kong’s plans for crypto exchange licensing and other crypto-related bills.

items.title: Xiaomi Auto recalls 30,931 SU7 EVs over parking feature bug
items.summary:
- Xiaomi Auto recalls 30,931 SU7 standard edition EVs due to a malfunction in the autonomous parking feature.
- The recall includes models produced from Feb. 6, 2024, to Nov. 26, 2024, affected by a software error.
- The issue disrupts time synchronization, leading to potential scratches or collisions by failing to detect static obstacles.
- Over 70 SU7 owners reported problems with the parking feature on Nov. 14, 2024.
- Xiaomi will provide a free over-the-air software update to fix the system bug.
- Despite the recall, Xiaomi Auto delivered over 130,000 SU7 vehicles in 2024 and plans to launch the YU7 model in mid-2025.

items.title: MobiKwik’s co-founder and payments chief resigns
items.summary:
- MobiKwik's co-founder and Chief of Payments has resigned from his position.
- The resignation comes amid a challenging financial environment for the fintech company.
- MobiKwik has faced several setbacks, including regulatory scrutiny and market competition.

items.title: Solana stablecoin supply tops $10b, doubles since January
items.summary:
- Solana’s stablecoin supply has surpassed US$10 billion for the first time.
- This represents a 110% increase since January, when the supply was US$5.1 billion.
- The growth is mainly due to Circle’s USD Coin (USDC) issuance, with US$3.5 billion minted in the past week.
- USDC comprises nearly 80% of Solana’s stablecoin supply, increasing from US$4.2 billion to US$8 billion.
- Tether’s USDT contributed US$1.96 billion to Solana’s stablecoin ecosystem.
- The increase aligns with trends in decentralized finance (DeFi) and a rise in trading volume from memecoin activity.

items.title: Meta builds data center, invests $65b in AI growth
items.summary:
- Meta announces plans to advance AI initiatives by end of 2025.
- Aims to deploy Meta AI to over 1 billion users and establish Llama 4 as a leading AI tool.
- Building a data center with over 2 GW capacity, with 1 GW expected operational this year.
- Plans to operate over 1.3 million GPUs by end of 2025.
- Capital expenditures projected between $60 billion and $65 billion for 2025.
- Expanding AI workforce to enhance product and R&D.

items.title: Hot or not: What SEA investors are betting on and what they’re ignoring
ByteDance considers no-sale option for TikTok in US
items.summary:
- ByteDance is exploring options to keep TikTok operational in the US without selling its business.
- Bill Ford, a board member of ByteDance, mentioned changing control of TikTok’s US operations as a possible solution.
- Ongoing discussions between US and Chinese officials may impact the situation, with optimism expressed regarding the dialogue.

items.title: Trump’s AI project Stargate set to use solar power
items.summary:
- Trump's AI project Stargate aims to leverage solar power for its energy needs.
- The initiative reflects a growing trend in sustainable technology solutions.
- Discussions surrounding the project highlight its potential impact on AI and renewable energy sectors.

items.title: Is it go time for Superbank’s IPO?
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- There is growing speculation around Superbank's potential IPO.
- Analysts are discussing market conditions and investor sentiments regarding the timing.
- Superbank aims to leverage current financial trends to optimize its public offering.

items.title: India’s Nykaa parent expands with new subsidiary in Oman
items.summary:
- FSN E-Commerce Ventures, the parent company of online beauty retailer Nykaa, launched a new subsidiary in Oman called Nysaa Cosmetics SPC.
- Nysaa Cosmetics SPC will operate as a wholly-owned entity of Nessa International Holdings Limited.
- The subsidiary will sell beauty and personal care products, including cosmetics and perfumes.
- It begins operations with an initial share capital of approximately 6 lakh rupees (around US$6.961).
- This move follows Nykaa’s establishment of a similar subsidiary in Qatar in July 2024.

items.title: Egypt launches updated AI strategy for growth in Middle East
items.summary:
- Egypt has launched the second phase of its National AI Strategy for 2025 to 2030.
- The updated plan aims to establish Egypt as a key AI hub in the Middle East and Africa.
- The strategy prioritizes six areas: governance, technology, data, infrastructure, ecosystem, and talent.
- The plan is expected to support the “Digital Egypt” initiative and establish over 250 AI-driven companies by 2030.
- Egypt aims for AI to contribute over US$42.7 billion to its GDP, representing 7.7% of the economy.

items.title: Trump signs AI order, reverses Biden’s plan
items.summary:
- President Donald Trump signed an executive order to strengthen the US's position in AI.
- An AI Action Plan is to be developed within 180 days.
- The plan aims to improve US competitiveness in AI and address economic, security, and societal issues.
- The order includes a reevaluation of previous policies from the Biden administration, specifically canceling Biden's 2023 executive order on AI risks.

items.title: Indian craft beer brand Medusa raises $6.5m for expansion
items.author: Avneet Singh, Amal N Parikh, Ashwin Kedia, Ramesh Damani
items.summary:
- Medusa Beverages raised 56 crore rupees (approximately US$6.5 million) in a Series A funding round.
- Financing co-led by Amal N Parikh and Ashwin Kedia, with participation from Ramesh Damani and others.
- Funds will be used for expansion, distributor partnerships, and enhancing market presence in India, targeting Assam, Andhra Pradesh, and Maharashtra.

items.title: These are the most active investors in Vietnam’s startups
LG Energy Solution reports first $158m loss in three years
items.summary:
- LG Energy Solution reported a $158 million loss, the first in three years.
- The loss is attributed to rising production costs and decreasing demand for electric vehicle batteries.
- The company's revenue also declined, highlighting challenges in the current market landscape.

items.title: AWS invests $8.3b in western India for cloud infrastructure
items.summary:
- Amazon Web Services (AWS) plans to invest US$8.3 billion in cloud infrastructure in Maharashtra, India.
- The investment is expected to add over US$15 billion to India’s GDP according to AWS CEO Matt Garman.
- AWS has committed a total investment of US$12.7 billion in India by 2030 to meet the increasing demand for cloud and AI services.
- AWS previously invested US$3.7 billion in Maharashtra between 2016 and 2022.

items.title: Perplexity launches AI assistant to rival Siri, ChatGPT
items.summary:
- AI startup Perplexity launched the Perplexity Assistant feature for Android on Jan. 23.
- The assistant can book reservations, hail rides, and set reminders, supporting 15 languages, available on Google Play Store.
- Plans are underway to expand to iOS devices, depending on Apple's approval.
- The launch creates competition with ChatGPT's Tasks and voice assistants like Siri and Alexa.

items.title: SG’s Everstone buys majority stake in SaaS firm Wingify
items.summary:
- Everstone Capital has acquired a majority stake in Wingify, a SaaS company, for around $300 million.
- This investment marks a significant milestone for Wingify as it aims to expand its global presence.
- The acquisition is expected to strengthen Wingify’s capabilities in the marketing and optimization software sector.

items.title: Anthropic launches Citations feature to improve AI accuracy
items.summary:
- Anthropic launched a new Citations feature on Jan. 23 to enhance AI accuracy by linking answers to specific text in documents.
- The feature is accessible via Anthropic’s developer API and Google’s Vertex AI platform, compatible with models like Claude 3.5 Sonnet and Haiku.
- Usage costs depend on document length; processing a 100-page document costs about US$0.30 with Sonnet and US$0.08 with Haiku.

items.title: Ex-Binance CEO takes active role in rebranded YZi Labs
items.author: Changpeng Zhao, Ella Zhang
items.summary:
• Changpeng 'CZ' Zhao, former CEO of Binance, will take an active role at YZi Labs, previously known as Binance Labs.
• This move follows Zhao's recent legal issues, including four months in the US on money laundering-related charges.
• Zhao is listed as an 'intern' on the company's site, with unclear official title.
• YZi Labs is expanding its focus beyond crypto, now investing in AI and biotech.
• Ella Zhang, the former head of Binance Labs, will return as the head of YZi Labs.

items.title: Trump dismisses Musk’s criticism of Stargate AI project
items.summary:
- US President Donald Trump dismissed Elon Musk’s criticism of the Stargate AI initiative, which has a funding of US$500 billion.
- Musk questioned the funding's legitimacy, stating that SoftBank has less than US$10 billion secured.
- Trump stated that he is not bothered by Musk's comments and defended the intelligence of the people involved in the deal.
- Stargate was officially launched on January 21, with notable attendees including SoftBank CEO Masayoshi Son and OpenAI CEO Sam Altman.
- Musk's criticism hints at tension in his relationship with Trump, as noted by one of Trump's advisers.

items.title: Digital firm Catcha Digital acquires Nexible to expand reach
items.summary:
- Catcha Digital acquired Nexible Solutions on January 24.
- Catcha Digital is a leading digital investment firm; Nexible specializes in IT consulting and system integration.
- The acquisition aims for collaboration in the digital sector; financial details were not disclosed.
- Both firms plan to explore new opportunities through their combined efforts.

items.title: Tiger Global-backed Indian edtech firm cuts losses by 58%
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Scaler, an edtech company in Bengaluru, reduced its FY24 losses to 138.8 crore rupees (around US$16 million), a 58% decrease from the previous year.
- The company cut total expenses by 22.1%, with notable reductions in employee benefits (28.6%), advertising costs (35.7%), and legal charges (72.5%).
- Operating revenue increased by 21.4% year-on-year to 384.5 crore rupees (around US$44.58 million) due to strong demand for upskilling courses in AI, machine learning, and data science.
- Total income, including interest and non-operating income, rose by 20% to 389 crore rupees (around US$45.1 million).
- Scaler raised US$55 million in series B funding in 2022, backed by investors including Lightrock India, Sequoia Capital India, and Tiger Global.

items.title: MakeMyTrip Q3 profit up 11.8%, driven by India travel boom
items.summary:
- MakeMyTrip reported a net profit of US$27.1 million for Q3 2024, an 11.8% YoY increase.
- Revenue grew by 24.8% to US$267.4 million, primarily due to strong performance in hotels and packages.
- The company plans to acquire Happay for US$11.7 million to improve its corporate travel services.

items.title: Tesla to deliver revamped Model Y in US for $60k
items.summary:
- Tesla will start delivering the revamped Model Y, named Juniper, in the US from March.
- Priced at $59,990 (before $7,500 federal tax credit), it features a redesigned exterior, upgraded light bars, and improved seating.
- Orders are already open in Canada and Europe, and sales in China began earlier this month.
- This release is part of Tesla's strategy to refresh its lineup amid increased competition and falling deliveries in 2024.
- The Model Y Juniper follows the Cybertruck, which was the best-selling electric truck in the US in late 2023.

items.title: Taiwan’s reclaimed wafer supplier to build $76m plant
items.summary:
- Phoenix Silicon International Corp is constructing a new plant with an investment of NT$2.5 billion (US$76.3 million).
- The facility will cater to the rising demand for reclaimed wafers due to the expansion of AI technologies.
- Producing a single 3-nanometer or 5-nanometer wafer requires over two reclaimed wafers for testing.
- The shift to 2-nanometer wafer production has increased the demand for reclaimed wafers, which began this year.
- By the end of 2025, Phoenix aims to increase its annual production capacity to 800,000 12-inch wafers, a rise from 630,000 units in 2024.

items.title: UK investigates Apple, Google over dominance under new law
items.summary:
- The UK’s Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) has launched investigations into Apple and Google.
- The investigations assess the companies’ dominance in mobile ecosystems as part of the new Digital Markets, Competition and Consumers Act.
- The aim is to determine if Apple and Google hold “strategic market status” in their operating systems, app stores, and browsers.
- The CMA's inquiries will consider implications for UK consumers, businesses, and app developers dependent on these platforms.
- The investigation will focus on competition, the extension of market power, and potential exploitative practices.

items.title: Ex-PropertyGuru execs bet big on rent-to-own in Indonesia
items.author: Winston Lee, Marine Novita, Lau Xin Yuan
items.summary:
- PropertyGuru exited Indonesia in August 2023, shutting down its Rumah marketplace after failed business models.
- Former PropertyGuru executives Winston Lee and Marine Novita have launched a new proptech company, MilikiRumah, in September 2024.
- MilikiRumah has raised S$2 million (US$1.4 million) from various investors, including notable figures from PropertyGuru.
- The company is focusing on a rent-to-own model to address low home ownership rates in Indonesia, where only 56% of households in Jakarta own their homes.
- Lee and Novita are confident that their experience in the proptech sector will give MilikiRumah an advantage.

items.title: Indian proptech startup Landeed nets $5m funding
items.author: Sanjay Mandava, ZJ Lin, Jonathan Richards
items.summary:
- Landeed, a Hyderabad-based proptech startup, raised approximately $5 million in a funding round led by 10x Founders Fund.
- Notable investors included Oliver Jung, Paradigm Shift, Pioneer Fund, and founders from Onboard and Snapdocs.
- The funding will be used to launch Landeed Labs, enhance AI capabilities, innovate products, recruit talent, and develop tools for property transactions.
- Founded in 2022, Landeed aims to reduce inefficiencies in India's fragmented property records by consolidating data across 24 states.

items.title: SG digibank Anext names new CEO
items.summary:
- Anext Bank CEO Su Mei Toh has resigned to pursue new opportunities.
- Toh led the bank's growth into a regional player in digital financing for SMEs.
- Effective immediately, Kai Qiu, Deputy CEO and CTO, has been appointed as her successor.

items.title: Crypto execs optimistic on US regulations under Trump
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Executives from major cryptocurrency firms like Coinbase, Binance, and Circle are optimistic about US crypto regulations this year.
- This optimism follows Donald Trump’s return as president, who is viewed as a pro-crypto advocate.
- Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong refers to this as the start of a new era after past regulatory difficulties.
- The US SEC has launched a “crypto task force” to create a regulatory framework focusing on token registration and compliance.
- Potential advancements in regulations from Binance CEO Richard Teng could boost confidence in digital assets like Bitcoin.
- Circle CEO Jeremy Allaire hopes for bipartisan support in Congress for stablecoin regulation.

items.title: India to launch first domestic chip this year
items.summary:
- India is set to launch its first domestic semiconductor chip within this year.
- The initiative aims to bolster self-reliance in technology and reduce dependency on imports.
- This project is part of a broader strategy to enhance India's position in the global semiconductor market.

items.title: Reliance to build AI data center in western India
items.summary:
- Reliance Group is planning to build a data center in Jamnagar, Gujarat, potentially one of the largest globally.
- The facility is expected to have a capacity of three gigawatts to support significant AI workloads.
- Reliance aims to power the data center with renewable energy.
- The project cost is estimated between US$20 billion to US$30 billion, with unclear financing details.

items.title: Blockchain unicorn StarkWare appoints new technology chief
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- StarkWare has appointed Lior Goldberg as its new chief technology officer.
- Goldberg has been with the company since its inception, driving technological development.
- StarkWare specializes in scaling solutions for blockchain networks, particularly Ethereum and Bitcoin.
- The company is valued at US$8 billion as of 2022 and has over 200 employees globally.
- Goldberg founded and led the team behind Starknet, a Layer 2 blockchain on Ethereum, joining StarkWare seven years ago.

items.title: New York fines PayPal $2m for cybersecurity failures
items.summary:
- PayPal fined $2 million due to a cybersecurity incident in late 2022 that exposed customers' personal information, including Social Security numbers.
- The New York Department of Financial Services (NYDFS) announced the penalty after finding that PayPal failed to implement essential cybersecurity measures.
- Since the incident, PayPal has improved security by requiring multifactor authentication for all US customer accounts.
- NYDFS noted that the necessary security measures were not in place during the breach, violating cybersecurity regulations established in 2017.

items.title: Indian construction materials firm raises $120m pre-IPO
items.summary:
- An Indian construction materials firm has raised $120 million in a pre-IPO funding round.
- The funding is aimed at boosting its growth ahead of an upcoming initial public offering.
- The firm plans to use the funds for technology upgrades and expanding its operations.

items.title: YouTuber MrBeast denies TikTok role after US bid reports
items.author: Jimmy Donaldson
items.summary:
- MrBeast, also known as Jimmy Donaldson, clarifies he is not involved in bids to purchase TikTok’s US operations.
- Reports suggested he was part of an investor group led by Jesse Tinsley from Recruiter.com Ventures.
- Speculation began after a January 13 post where Donaldson joked about buying TikTok to prevent its ban.
- His representative, Matthew Hiltzik, confirmed no exclusive agreements with any buyers and discussions with multiple parties are ongoing.
- The details of the investor group and bid amount remain unclear; Tinsley’s representative has not commented.
